intro: Ilex amazonensis, commonly known as the Amazon holly, is a species of evergreen shrub or small tree native to the rainforests of South America. It belongs to the family Aquifoliaceae and is characterized by its glossy, dark green leaves and small, red berries that are toxic to humans but serve as a food source for various wildlife. The plant typically grows in humid, shaded environments and can reach heights of up to 10 meters. It is valued for its ornamental appeal and has been studied for its potential medicinal properties. Ilex amazonensis plays an important role in the ecological balance of its native habitat.
